spans.text: Early cherry blossoms on the bridge. The temperature of the south wind. The smell of soil.
These all remind Taki of her very first favorite song...

In her 14-year-old dream, the starting point of the journey was the gentle beat of the snare drum, and the light rhythm on the cymbal attracted her to constantly look towards the higher and farther clouds.
——"Fly faster, Taki!"
Now the swallows have flown back, and the final stop of the journey is also waving to her.
...It's done.
(Is it finished just like that?)
(I'm kind of looking forward to how Raana will play this lick.)
(Soyo doesn't know, Anon will probably pretend to complain that it's too difficult.)
(What kind of lyrics will Tomori write...)
(If possible, I'd also like to let Umiri and that guy listen.)
(...Will everyone like it?)
At least I like it very much.
Her footsteps towards the practice room were more eager than ever.
Ah, this sheet music... It seems like the teacher handwritten it for me in the 3rd grade of elementary school and scanned it for me.
There isn't even a song title. And then...
Blue Hearts and Ging Nang BOYZ. Haha, also handwritten, the markings have been worn away to the point where they are completely invisible.
It doesn't matter, I can play it with my eyes closed.
This volume is from when I first learned to play the drums. It took a long, long time to get used to the hi-hat from the snare drum... I practiced until my left foot cramped.
The next volume is...
...Found it.
Forcefully strike the drumsticks, the performance will take over the breath, emptying the brain.
(If possible, I really want to play all the phrases in the world that I know and don't know.)
Time is limited, time is limited.
(It's a good thing there are no mirrors in the practice room, so I don't have to watch the countdown to the explosion.)
(Just keep playing like this until morning, until I fall down...)
(Will it become a drummer's case of death from overwork?)
...I wonder who will be the "first witness" in the end.
"I really don't want to cause trouble for others," a somewhat absurd thought suddenly flashed through her mind.
After I die, what should I do with my inheritance? Who needs to explain it to everyone?
Mom's health is not good, I'm really sorry to let her know that her daughter has passed away...
The "last work" has been completed, the last song has been completed, but...
——Taki belatedly realized that there were too many, too many things that she couldn't wait to prepare.
For a will, is it the same format as writing a letter...
Curtain Call
Hello, may I ask if this is...?
Sister?
Taki!
Uh...
What's wrong, what happened?
You didn't answer the door for a long time...
I'm practicing drums.
(I can't imagine anyone would come knocking at 5:00 in the morning.)
Practicing drums? That's good... Am I bothering you?
(I'm sorry, sister. You're the last one to come...)
Taki, what's wrong with you? Is there something wrong?
You look terrible, does something hurt...?
No, nothing.
...But you look like you're about to cry.
I'm practicing drums, I'm just a little sweaty.
Please come in, sister.
Sorry, sister, the panda cup you liked just broke.
Can I pour you some tea in a paper cup?
Anything is fine, I've told you so many times not to be so polite...
I'm your sister, aren't I?
...Yeah.
Chilled green tea was slowly poured into the cup, Maki silently watching Taki's movements.
If Taki were to choose, it would definitely be green tea.
I happened to buy some at the convenience store the day before yesterday...
Taki, you've liked things that adults like since you were a child, green tea, rock and roll, working... of course, pandas don't count.
What are you talking about, sister... Rock and roll and working don't count either.
I want to say...
Maki was silent for a while, gazing at Taki's face.
It seems like my sister grew up when I, mom, and dad didn't know.
She doesn't like to cry, doesn't like to act spoiled. It seems like she grew up faster than other children since she was little.
...I didn't realize this until now.
Taki, am I a bad sister?
...Why are you suddenly saying this?
Can't I?
No... it's just that you've never said this before, sister.
Sitting on either side of a dining table, Maki's face looks like myself five years from now.
Grasping the cold cup, memories of the past and thoughts about the future lengthened the time of silence.
Taki, I had a dream last night.
Why are you so nervous. It's not that kind of bad dream.
I dreamed of when you were little, and I took you to play on the slide in the park outside the wind instrument class.
You laughed very happily, we climbed up and slid down again and again, then climbed up again.
For some reason, the little you behind me turned into an adult while sliding...
Then, I turned my head and you were gone. I couldn't find you anywhere.
Sorry... it seems like it's still a bad dream.
Did we ever play on the slide together?
Maki shook her head.
So the dream is fake, please don't worry.
But I still decided to come and find Taki.
I'm relieved to see that you're doing well.
You always have a bitter face...
Is the song finished?
It's finished.
That's great. What did I say?
You can definitely do it.
Taki, do you want to wait a while? Why don't you contact your friends in the band...
...Is it really okay for me to be the first one to listen?
Yeah...
I want to let my sister listen.
Glancing out the window, the white moon was sinking inch by inch. The morning sun is rising.
It turns out you don't have to stand in front of a mirror to count down your remaining time.
Sister...
Music is playing in the earphones.
"Did you say anything?" Maki asked with her mouth.
Taki slowly shook her head.
(As expected, I can't say it no matter what...)
("I'm about to die" kind of words.)
(I don't want you to worry, I don't want you to be sad. I want you to see more of my cool side.)
(My heartbeat it's...)
Sister, can you...
Taki's voice trembled a little.
Can you stay here with me for a while?
I didn't sleep last night, sister. I'll fall asleep soon.
......Of course.
Sister, do you like this song?
I like it very much.
That's great... because I like it too.
Sister?
Yeah?
What I wanted to say is... I just wanted to say that you, sister, you are not bad at all.
(We didn't play together, we didn't sit together and chat all night... other people's sisters might do that.)
(...Even without those.)
Sister, to me, you have always been the best.
Please don't have such a bitter face at this time.
...Taki can see even with her eyes closed?
Of course.
After all, I am...
(Always looking into the distance at you, your soaring figures.)
(At the very end... I will also go to my cloud.)
Sister?
...What's wrong, Taki?
Please forgive her childish repetition, she has one last question.
(Do you think there will be rock and roll in heaven too...)
The cherry blossoms on Men'omoto bridge are in bloom, the swallows have flown back to their nests, and the music travels along the clouds all the way to the moon.
报幕
报幕
